qas.question: Who wrote the biography entitled Life of Antony?
Life of Antony played an important role in the spreading of ascetic ideals in what religion?
The biography, Life of Antony, also resembles of the life of who?
The so-called Athanasian Creed draws upon the phraseology of what?
About whom did he write his most widely-read work?
Why was this work considered to be important?

answers.text: spreading of the ascetic ideal in Eastern and Western Christianity

qas.question: What does the Athanasian Creed draw upon?
Who wrote the autobiography entitled Life of Antony?
Life of Antony played an unimportant role in the spreading of ascetic ideals in what religion?
The biography, Life of Antony, also resembles of the life of what religion?
About whom did he write his least widely-read work?

context: His biography of <a4_0>Anthony the Great<a4_0/> entitled Life of Antony(Βίος καὶ Πολιτεία Πατρὸς Ἀντωνίου, Vita Antonii) became his most widely-read work. Translated into several languages, it played an important role in the <a5_0>spreading of the ascetic ideal in <a1_0><b10_0>Eastern and Western <b11_0>Christianity<b11_0/><b10_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>. Depicting Anthony as an <a6_0>illiterate and holy<a6_0/> man who through his existence in a primordial landscape has an absolute connection to the divine truth, the biography also resembles the life of his biographer <a0_0><a2_0><a7_0>Athanasius<a7_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>. It later served as an inspiration to Christian monastics in both the East and the West. The so-called <b9_0>Athanasian<b9_0/> Creed dates from well after Athanasius's death and draws upon the phraseology of <a3_0><a8_0><b12_0>Augustine's De trinitate<b12_0/><a8_0/><a3_0/>.
